text: Two Worlds () is the German version of an English-language film directed by Ewald André Dupont. == Cast == * Helene Sieburg - Esther Goldschneider * Hermann Vallentin - Uhrmacher Simon Goldschneider * Friedrich Kayßler - Oberst von Kaminsky * Peter Voß - Leutnant Stanislaus von Kaminsky * Maria Paudler - Mizzi Staudinger * Julius Brandt - Korporal * Paul Graetz - Schumacher Mendel * Anton Pointner - Hauptmann Ballentin * Fritz Spira - Major * Harry Terry - Plünderer * Boris Ranevsky - Russischer Fähnrich * Leo Monosson - Österreichischer Soldat * Rudolf Meinhard-Jünger - Ordonanzsoldat * Michael von Newlinsky - Ordonnanzoffizier == References == == External links == * Category:1930 films Category:1930s war drama films Category:1930 multilingual films Category:German war drama films Category:German films Category:British films Category:German-language films Category:Films directed by E. A. Dupont Category:Films with screenplays by Franz Schulz Category:World War I films set on the Eastern Front Category:Films about Jews and Judaism Category:German multilingual films Category:Films shot at Elstree Studios Category:German black-and-white films Category:British multilingual films Category:1930 drama films
title: Two Worlds (1930 German film)
